name: ptr::non_null::NonNull::<T>::with_addr

num::nonzero::NonZero::<T>::get.doc: Returns the contained value as a primitive type.

ptr::mut_ptr::<impl *mut T>::with_addr.doc:
Creates a new pointer with the given address and the [provenance][crate::ptr#provenance] of
 `self`.

 This is similar to a `addr as *mut T` cast, but copies
 the *provenance* of `self` to the new pointer.
 This avoids the inherent ambiguity of the unary cast.

 This is equivalent to using [`wrapping_offset`][pointer::wrapping_offset] to offset
 `self` to the given address, and therefore has all the same capabilities and restrictions.

 This is a [Strict Provenance][crate::ptr#strict-provenance] API.

doc:
Creates a new pointer with the given address and the [provenance][crate::ptr#provenance] of
 `self`.

 For more details, see the equivalent method on a raw pointer, [`pointer::with_addr`].

 This is a [Strict Provenance][crate::ptr#strict-provenance] API.
